item.title: Google’s answer to the AI arms race — promote the guy behind its data center tech
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Amin Vahdat has been promoted to chief technologist for AI infrastructure, a newly created position reporting directly to CEO Sundar Pichai.

item.title: State attorneys general warn Microsoft, OpenAI, Google, and other AI giants to fix ‘delusional’ outputs
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The letter demanded companies institute new safeguards to keep users safe from harmful psychological impacts.

item.title: Nvidia is reportedly testing tracking software as chip-smuggling rumors swirl
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: A new software option could make it possible to see the approximate location of some of Nvidia's AI chips.

item.title: Spotify tests more personalized, AI-powered ‘Prompted Playlists’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The playlists can factor in world knowledge, go back to your listening history from day one, and be refreshed daily or weekly.

item.title: Google is testing AI-powered article overviews on select publications’ Google News pages
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: By adding AI-powered article overviews, Google says users will get more context before they click through to read an article.

item.title: ElevenLabs just hit a $6.6B valuation. Its CEO says the real money isn’t in voice anymore.
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: ElevenLabs has made a name for itself building realistic AI voices.   What started as two Polish engineers annoyed by terrible movie dubbing has grown into a profitable company now valued at $6.6 billion, doubling from just nine months ago. The company recently announced a $100 million tender offer led by Sequoia and ICONIQ, with participation from a16z […]

item.title: ChatGPT is Apple’s most downloaded app of 2025 in the US
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: This is ChatGPT's first year as the No. 1 app on the U.S. App Store by downloads.

item.title: Google launches managed MCP servers that let AI agents simply plug into its tools
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Google is rolling out managed MCP servers to make its services “agent-ready by design,” starting with Maps and BigQuery, aiming to simplify messy integrations and help AI agents use real tools.

item.title: AI startup Tavus founder says users talk to its AI Santa ‘for hours’ per day
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Tavus has launched a new experience where you can chat with an AI Santa that asks personal questions and remembers your interests.

item.title: Figma launches new AI-powered object removal and image extension
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Figma is launching a new image editing toolbar to bring all its features in one place.

item.title: Google launches sub-$5 AI Plus plan in India to compete with ChatGPT Go
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: For new users in India, Google is offering an AI Plus subscription for ₹199 ($2.21) for the first six months, after which you'll have to pay ₹399 ($4.44).

item.title: CoreWeave CEO defends AI circular deals as ‘working together’
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The CEO of the AI data center provider, which has Nvidia as an investor and a supplier, described the environment as a "violent change" in demand.

item.title: Unconventional AI confirms its massive $475M seed round
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Led by Naveen Rao, the former head of AI at Databricks, the new hardware startup is valued at $4.5 billion.

item.title: Cashew Research is going after the $90B market research industry with AI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Cashew Research uses AI to automate the market research process while still collecting real-world data from humans.

item.title: Max Hodak is more worried about Twitter than brain-computer interface hacking
item.dc:creator: Maggie Nye
item.description: This week on StrictlyVC Download, Connie Loizos speaks with Science Corp. founder Max Hodak to discuss how brain-computer interfaces are arriving faster than anyone realizes. The Neuralink co-founder and former president shares how his company recently achieved what may be the biggest breakthrough in vision restoration in decades, enabling 80% of blind patients to read […]

item.title: B Capital founding partner Kabir Narang leaves to launch new investment platform
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Kabir Narang is laying the groundwork for a new investment platform slated for 2026 that will focus on "compounding at the intersection of technology, AI, and global capital flows."

item.title: Why Cursor’s CEO believes OpenAI, Anthropic competition won’t crush his startup
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: After reaching $1 billion in annualized revenue, Anysphere CEO Michael Truell explained the features his company is focused on building out.

item.title: Rivian is building its own AI assistant
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The EV maker will likely share more details on its upcoming AI & Autonomy Day scheduled for December 11.

item.title: Three in 10 US teens use AI chatbots every day, but safety concerns are growing
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: While teenagers may start out using AI chatbots for basic questions, their relationship with chatbot platforms has the potential to turn addictive.

item.title: Slack CEO Denise Dresser to join OpenAI as chief revenue officer
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: OpenAI says that Dresser will be responsible for the company's revenue strategy in enterprise and customer success.
